isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 5000 i Series before September 1997 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 118) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Item 5), elbow fittings (Item 4), air springs (bags) (Item 1), height control valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Item 2) and lateral control arm (Item 23) - should be checked at the time the vehicle is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air springs (bags) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 118) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or installed onto the air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 118) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 3) in place on suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) and install two hex head bolts (Item 6) thru height control valve and suspension crossmember bracket and install hex lock nuts (Item 7). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 119 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install height control valve linkage (Item 5) onto threaded ball pivot of height control valve arm (Item 6) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.

Push push to connect connector (Item 4) and air line (supply) (Item 1) into elbow fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 2) into compression nut (Item 8) of elbow fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
Check cab ride height between bottom of left and right cab mount plates (Items 19 and 20) and top of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21). Cab air suspension ride height is 4 1/2 inches (114.3 mm) (Figure 180) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position one shock absorber (Item 2) in place between left cab mount plate (Item 19) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

Install hex head bolt (Item 10) thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) and the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 9). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 8) thru left cab mount plate (Item 19) and the top of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 9). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position one shock absorber (Item 2) in place between right cab mount plate (Item 20) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

Install hex head bolt (Item 10) thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) and the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 9). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 8) thru right cab mount plate (Item 20) and the top of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 9). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position one air spring (bag) (Item 1) at threaded stud on left cab mount plate (Item 19), then screw it on until top of air spring (bag) is tight against left cab mount plate.
Position one air spring (bag) (Item 1) at threaded stud on right cab mount plate (Item 20), then screw it on until top of air spring (bag) is tight against right cab mount plate.

Release jack placed between frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) , lower cab, making sure bottom threaded stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) are positioned into mounting holes of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).
Install jam nut (Item 16) at the bottom of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) securing air springs (bags) to suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21). Tighten to 30 Lbf-ft (41 N•m).

Thread elbow fitting (Item 4) into bottom of each air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push tee fitting (not shown) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 4) at the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (Item 5) into compression nut of tee fitting (not shown) in elbow fitting (Item 4) at the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 5) into compression nut elbow fitting (Item 4) at the bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of left and right cab mount plates (Items 19 and 20) and top of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21). Cab air suspension ride height is 4 1/2 inches (114.3 mm) (Figure 180) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 23) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 23) in mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) and install hex head bolt (Item 11) from the rear thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket and lateral control rod (Item 23) and install hex lock nut (Item 12). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 23) in mounting bracket of left cab mount plate (Item 19) and install hex head bolt (Item 13) from the rear thru mounting bracket of left cab mount plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 12). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
